1450172229052928000.text: As a proud beneficiary of the labor movement, I will always stand in solidarity with our workers who are courageously paving the way for a better future in the workplace. And I'm proud to fight for them every day in Congress.

1450172226339319811.text: I love telling that story because it gets to the heart of the matter. My grandpa didn't know what the terms of that contract were, whether those workers were bargaining over better pay or better working conditions, but what he did know: We always stood on the side of the workers.

1450172225101914114.text: Younger and a little less patient than I am today, I suggested we go to the perfectly fine market right next to us. Without hesitation, my grandpa says, "No, we can't go there. The meat cutters are on strike. And we ain't crossing that picket line."

1450172223348621317.text: One day, I was driving him around, and like usual, we stopped at just about every store in town to make sure he got the right groceries from the right places. And at a certain point, already hours into this thing, he tells me we've got to drive to yet another shop miles away.

1450172219955597317.text: Toward the end of my grandfather's life, I used to help with his grocery shopping. I don't know how your grandparents shop, but my grandfather, who was Italian, turned it into an art form. He used to make multiple stops all over town to make sure he was getting the best deals.

1450172217128538122.text:
As workers across the country demonstrate their collective power to fight for better workplace conditions, I'm reminded of one of the greatest lessons my grandfather, a life-long union member, taught me: Never cross the picket line.

https://t.co/vG0cb0u3mw

1347908014993526785.text: At least five people lost their lives because of what happened last week, and our national security was put at severe risk. Not only must we get to the bottom of how and why this was allowed to happen, we have a duty to ensure it never EVER can happen again.

1347908014053928961.text: This unprecedented behavior cannot go unanswered. President Trump must be repudiated. I am calling for his Cabinet to invoke the 25th Amendment. If they lack the courage to do so, we must file Articles of Impeachment to remove the President.

1347908013177376770.text: The defining trait of our democracy for the past 200 years has been the peaceful transfer of power from one administration to another. Instead of supporting our democratic values, this President has chosen to plant and sow unfounded conspiracies about a free and fair election.

1347908012309159936.text: We must not ignore that what happened on Wednesday was an act of domestic terrorism that was brought on by incendiary comments and behavior of the United States President.

1347908011449331713.text: The evidence we have seen thus far of rioters in possession of zip tie handcuffs, Molotov cocktails, and other weapons is deeply unsettling and is being fully investigated.

1347908010581102594.text: As for the perpetrators: we are working closely with the @FBI and U.S. Attorney offices around the country to identify those who participated, and ensure they are brought to justice.

1347908009700302849.text: Additionally, for the entire U.S. Congress, including key figures in the line of succession, to be left so vulnerable to violent insurrectionists is a failure. Plain and simple. It’s unacceptable, and can never be allowed to happen again.

1347908008681070595.text: As for disturbing videos we’ve all seen that seem to show some officers letting rioters behind barricades & taking selfies with them: I can assure you these videos are being thoroughly investigated & there will be consequences for any deviations from proper training & protocols.

1347908007519268866.text: Meanwhile, there was an epic failure of intelligence/ preparation among leadership in the department. The Capitol Police Chief & House Sergeant at Arms have resigned, an important step to fully uncover the failures of this event & reestablish trust in the security on Cap. Hill.

1347908006378426369.text: The vast majority of Capitol Police officers bravely defended our nation’s Capitol and put their lives on the line to protect Members of Congress and our historic Capitol building.

1347908001907277824.text: First and foremost, I am very upset and heartbroken over the murder of Officer Sicknick who passed away after an altercation with violent protesters on Weds. It’s become increasingly clear that rank &file members of the Cap Police were lead into an incredibly dangerous situation.

1347907999562670080.text:
As chair of the House Appropriations subcommittee that oversees the Capitol Police, I want to offer a few updates on the investigation taking place into Capitol Police and the violent insurrection that took place on Wednesday at our nation’s Capitol.
